Astheemployertheonusisonyoutodemonstrate.xfdf:original: As the employer the onus is on you to demonstrate that the job offer is bona fide Provide details regarding why you offered the position to this applicant If you have offered the applicant a supervisory or management position provide details regarding what experience the applicant previously obtained that convinced you that the applicant was qualified for the supervisory or management position

BUSINESSADDRESSIFDIFFERENTFROMABOVE.xfdf:original: BUSINESS ADDRESS IF DIFFERENT FROM ABOVE

Describetherecruitmentactivitiestypeloca.xfdf:original: Describe the recruitment activities type location and duration of advertisements interviews etc that led to this job offer including how you first came to know about this applicant For an applicant already working for you or for an applicant who was promoted to this position from within your business please describe the recruitment activities that led to the initial hiring including how you first came to know about this applicant

Explainwhytherecruitmenteffortwasunsucce.xfdf:original: Explain why the recruitment effort was unsuccessful in hiring a Canadian worker

Howmanydaysdidyouformallyrecruit.xfdf:original: How many days did you formally recruit

Ifyesdescribewhatcertificationlicensingo.xfdf:original: If yes describe what certification licensing or registration they require and provide this evidence at the time of application If no describe how this requirement will shortly be met

Ifyesdescribewhythelanguageisrequiredfor.xfdf:original: If yes describe why the language is required for the position

IfyesexplainthereasonswhyServiceCanadare.xfdf:original: If yes explain the reasons why Service Canada refused the Labour Market Impact Assessment
